nodes.text: Neil Patrick Harris (born June 15, 1973) is an American actor, writer, producer, comedian, magician, and singer. He served as an audiobook narrator for From a Certain Point of View and was the host of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge – Adventure Awaits.

Neil Patrick Harris is best known for his roles as Doogie Howser and Barney Stinson in the television series Doogie Howswer, M.D. (1989–1993) and How I Met Your Mother (2005–2014), Dr Horrible in Dr. Horrible's Sing-Along Blog (2008), and Hedwig in the Broadway play Hedwig and the Angry Inch. More recently, Harris has played the main antagonist Count Olaf in the Netflix television series A Series of Unfortunate Events (2017–2019), an adaptation of Lemony Snicket's titular children's novel series.
